subject: physics
question_html: <!-- HTML_TAG_START -->Pressure depends on distance as, $$P = {\alpha  \over \beta }\exp \left( { - {{\alpha z} \over {k\theta }}} \right)$$, where $$\alpha $$, $$\beta $$ are constants, z in distance, k is Boltzman's constant and $$\theta $$ is temperature. The dimention of  $$\beta $$ are<!-- HTML_TAG_END -->

options.label: a
options.html:
A
[M0L0T0]

options.label: b
options.html:
B
[M-1L-1T-1]

options.label: c
options.html:
C
[M0L2T0]

options.label: d
options.html:
D
[M-1L1T2]

explanation_html:
The given expression is

$$P = {\alpha \over \beta }\exp \left( { - {{\alpha z} \over {k\theta }}} \right)$$

Now,

$$[z] = [{L^1}]$$

$$[\theta ] = [{K^1}]$$

$$[k] = [{M^1}{L^2}{T^{ - 2}}{K^{ - 1}}]$$

Since the terms which are raised to power in an exponential function are dimensionless, we get

$$[\alpha] = \left[ {{{k\theta } \over z}} \right] = [{M^1}{L^1}{T^{ - 2}}]$$

Also, $$[P] =$$ $$\left[ {{\alpha \over \beta }} \right]$$

$$ \Rightarrow $$ $$\left[ \beta \right] = \left[ {{\alpha \over P}} \right]$$

$$ \Rightarrow $$ $$\left[ \beta \right] = \left[ {{{{M^1}{L^1}{T^{ - 2}}} \over {M{L^{ - 1}}{T^{ - 2}}}}} \right]$$ = $$[{M^0}{L^2}{T^0}]$$

Answer (C)
